flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction_rendered:
Relevant parts
  • 1/2" PVC pipe, 10' length
  • 1/2" PVC 90 degree elbow
  • screw pipe clamp
  • 1" x 3" 8' pine strapping
  • 3/4" pipe clamp
  • 1" ID, 1 1/4" OD vinyl hose
  • 1/2" Lath screws
  • Tape measure
  • Pencil or pen
  • empty 2 liter bottle
Tools
  • Hacksaw
  • Phillips 2 Screwdriver
  • Side cutters
  • Small Flathead Screwdriver
  • ratcheting pipe cutter

parts.notes: purchase as a contractors pack for discount
Purchase as a contractors pack for discount
Purchase in contractors pack for discount
You'll need at least 20 to make 10 launchers.

lines.text: Shopping: Most supplies are in the plumbing aisle of the store, particularly the pvc section. Wood will be over in the lumber area, and screws are in hardware. Look for a pvc pipe tool bundle in the irrigation supply area, near plumbing. Get at least one length of 1/2" pvc for thinner rockets. Cut pipe and boards in half to fit in your car.
lines.text_raw: '''Shopping:''' Most supplies are in the plumbing aisle of the store, particularly the pvc section. Wood will be over in the lumber area, and screws are in hardware. Look for a pvc pipe tool bundle in the irrigation supply area, near plumbing. Get at least one length of 1/2" pvc for thinner rockets. Cut pipe and boards in half to fit in your car.

lines.text: Preparation: Set up to make all 10 launchers. Set the supplies and tools up in a central area. Measuring tools and screwdrivers can be shared with 2 groups. Limited access to the ratcheting cutters is advisable. There should not be much waste and scrap from this project.
lines.text_raw: '''Preparation:''' Set up to make all 10 launchers. Set the supplies and tools up in a central area. Measuring tools and screwdrivers can be shared with 2 groups. Limited access to the ratcheting cutters is advisable. There should not be much waste and scrap from this project.

lines.text: Build: Groups should be 2-3 students max. Each group will need separate space. Shared tools should be accessible, students should share politely and efficiently. Having one/few cutters will reduce mischievous use. Check to make sure that the screws don't poke through the bottom of the boards. If they do, cover the screw tips with thick tape.
lines.text_raw: '''Build:''' Groups should be 2-3 students max. Each group will need separate space. Shared tools should be accessible, students should share politely and efficiently. Having one/few cutters will reduce mischievous use. Check to make sure that the screws don't poke through the bottom of the boards. If they do, cover the screw tips with thick tape.

lines.text: Setup for use: Make the paper or foam rockets by following one of the guides on the links page. Transporting the launchers can be done with an empty paper case box for the small parts, and the longer tubes can be bundled together. Set up the launchers in an area away from structures, such as an open field.
lines.text_raw: '''Setup for use:''' Make the paper or foam rockets by following one of the guides on the links page. Transporting the launchers can be done with an empty paper case box for the small parts, and the longer tubes can be bundled together. Set up the launchers in an area away from structures, such as an open field.

lines.text: Storage: The small parts for the launchers can be stored in an empty paper case box. The longer tubes will need to be secured with an elastic cord. Make a storage bag by cutting the leg off an old pair of pants and sewing one open end closed.
lines.text_raw: '''Storage:''' The small parts for the launchers can be stored in an empty paper case box. The longer tubes will need to be secured with an elastic cord. Make a storage bag by cutting the leg off an old pair of pants and sewing one open end closed.

lines.text: Followup: Graph the height of the flights. Make connections between rocket design and performance. Make multiple iterations towards the best rocket designs.
lines.text_raw: '''Followup:''' Graph the height of the flights. Make connections between rocket design and performance. Make multiple iterations towards the best rocket designs.

lines.text: Assemble your supplies.
lines.text_raw: Assemble your supplies.

lines.text: Use the attached shopping guide to make sure you have the parts, tools and supplies you will need to make the launcher.
lines.text_raw: Use the attached shopping guide to make sure you have the parts, tools and supplies you will need to make the launcher.

lines.text: The tools needed in this guide assumes that student groups will share access to the tools. Many of the tools are used briefly or intermittently, so groups should be able to balance their use.
lines.text_raw: The tools needed in this guide assumes that student groups will share access to the tools. Many of the tools are used briefly or intermittently, so groups should be able to balance their use.

lines.text: Set up the materials and tools.The cutting tools, either ratchet or hacksaw will need to be organized as a station. The fittings and other hardware may be best kept in one location. If you would like, you can sort the supplies into kits for each group.
lines.text_raw: Set up the materials and tools.The cutting tools, either ratchet or hacksaw will need to be organized as a station. The fittings and other hardware may be best kept in one location. If you would like, you can sort the supplies into kits for each group.

lines.text: Set up the bottle and adapter.
lines.text_raw: Set up the bottle and adapter.

lines.text: Cut the plastic collar off of the bottle. This will help the plastic tube to fit over the bottle neck better.
lines.text_raw: Cut the plastic collar off of the bottle. This will help the plastic tube to fit over the bottle neck better.

lines.text: Cut the clear tubing to length, approximately 6"
lines.text_raw: Cut the clear tubing to length, approximately 6"

lines.text: Fit the tubing over the bottle opening. On the other end of the tubing, it will go over the 3/4" pipe. If the pipe is not cut yet, it can be fit over a piece of scrap pipe.
lines.text_raw: Fit the tubing over the bottle opening. On the other end of the tubing, it will go over the 3/4" pipe. If the pipe is not cut yet, it can be fit over a piece of scrap pipe.

lines.text: Put the screw clamp over the clear pipe and tighten it with the screwdriver.
lines.text_raw: Put the screw clamp over the clear pipe and tighten it with the screwdriver.

lines.text: Put the second screw clamp, and tighten it over the 3/4" pvc pipe.
lines.text_raw: Put the second screw clamp, and tighten it over the 3/4" pvc pipe.

lines.text: Cut the pvc pipe to length. Cut two segments: 18" and 40"
lines.text_raw: Cut the pvc pipe to length. Cut two segments: 18" and 40"

lines.text: Cut the strapping into 4' segments. Use a handsaw or a power miter saw if the strapping was not cut in the store.
lines.text_raw: Cut the strapping into 4' segments. Use a handsaw or a power miter saw if the strapping was not cut in the store.

lines.text: Attach the long length of pvc to the strapping. To find the locations where the pipe will be attached, use these measurements: for one launcher per board, make a mark at 24". For two launchers per board, mark 16" and 32".
lines.text_raw: Attach the long length of pvc to the strapping. To find the locations where the pipe will be attached, use these measurements: for one launcher per board, make a mark at 24". For two launchers per board, mark 16" and 32".

lines.text: Attach the long length of pvc to the board. Place a piece of pvc at the mark. Put a pipe clamp over the pipe. Screw the pipe strap to the board with 1/2" screws.
lines.text_raw: Attach the long length of pvc to the board. Place a piece of pvc at the mark. Put a pipe clamp over the pipe. Screw the pipe strap to the board with 1/2" screws.

lines.text: Make the upright of the launcher.
lines.text_raw: Make the upright of the launcher.

lines.text: Put a 90 degree elbow onto the 3/4" pipe.
lines.text_raw: Put a 90 degree elbow onto the 3/4" pipe.

lines.text: Place the 18" pipe into the upright end of the 90 degree fitting.
lines.text_raw: Place the 18" pipe into the upright end of the 90 degree fitting.

lines.text: Make sure that the fitting and the upright pipe are securely attached by twisting them into place.
lines.text_raw: Make sure that the fitting and the upright pipe are securely attached by twisting them into place.

lines.text: Make an adapter to allow for 1/2" diameter rockets.
lines.text_raw: Make an adapter to allow for 1/2" diameter rockets.

lines.text: Cut a segment of 1/2" pvc pipe to 1'
lines.text_raw: Cut a segment of 1/2" pvc pipe to 1'

lines.text: Fold one piece of standard printer paper in thirds.
lines.text_raw: Fold one piece of standard printer paper in thirds.

lines.text: Cut one half of one of the segments
lines.text_raw: Cut one half of one of the segments

lines.text: Fold the remaining paper back up into thirds. When rolled around the 1/2" pipe, this paper adapter will make up the space between the pipes.
lines.text_raw: Fold the remaining paper back up into thirds. When rolled around the 1/2" pipe, this paper adapter will make up the space between the pipes.

lines.text: Slide the paper and 1/2" pipe into the 3/4" upright.
lines.text_raw: Slide the paper and 1/2" pipe into the 3/4" upright.

lines.text: The launcher can now be used for 3/4" and 1/2" diameter rockets.
lines.text_raw: The launcher can now be used for 3/4" and 1/2" diameter rockets.

lines.text: Disassemble the launcher for storage and transport.
lines.text_raw: Disassemble the launcher for storage and transport.

lines.text: Remove the 90 degree elbow from the long horizontal pipe.
lines.text_raw: Remove the 90 degree elbow from the long horizontal pipe.

lines.text: Loosen (but don't remove) one of the screws on the pipe strap.
lines.text_raw: Loosen (but don't remove) one of the screws on the pipe strap.

lines.text: Remove the long, horizontal pipe.
lines.text_raw: Remove the long, horizontal pipe.

lines.text: Place all the parts together for transport or storage. Putting them in a bag or long box will help keep all the parts organized.
lines.text_raw: Place all the parts together for transport or storage. Putting them in a bag or long box will help keep all the parts organized.

lines.text: When it is time to launch, remember to bring a screwdriver to tighten the pipe strap to the board. If the screw on the pipe strap is loose, the launcher may not stay upright consistently.
lines.text_raw: When it is time to launch, remember to bring a screwdriver to tighten the pipe strap to the board. If the screw on the pipe strap is loose, the launcher may not stay upright consistently.

guide.summary: This simple design will have you ready to launch rockets quickly and inexpensively.
guide.title: Stomp Rocket Launcher
